result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelique D Kraft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 40 days were granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with Pick N Save store listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Angelique D Kraft in court, in custody, with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - 40 days)   **CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE**

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR          **Transfer allowed to Washington County**
 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Pick n Save store listed in criminal complaint

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department. **

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-01-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Angelique D Kraft in court, in custody, with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
appointing Adam Schleis
Hearing at 09-16-2015 09:30 am
Defendant to have no contact with the Pick N Save stores in Waukesha County.

Defendant Angelique D Kraft in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
